## Natural history notes

The narrowleaf primrose-willow (Ludwigia lineris) is a native willow found in wetlands throughout the southeastern United States. In Florida, this plant can be found throughout the panhandle and into the central part of the state. Like other primrose-willows, this plant has yellow flowers, but it can be distinguished from others by its thin, narrow leaves. .
